page.title: 02A PERSONAL IMPRESSION
page.content: {AN IMPRESSION OF OUR SURVEY AREA { } We conducted our survey on a Friday afternoon late in June on a fine summer's day. Twenty-eight of us set out on our bikes and on foot, to count those things the survey required. Our area was quite flat and consisted of mostly fields with narrow country lanes. Some grass was growing and was being grazed upon by{Friesian} cattle, but much was being cut and collected for sileage. The area was very quiet with few people around except where the main Nantwich to Middlewich road ran. Here, there was a steady stream of busy traffic. Here also was our only pub, the Waggon and Horses, only yards from a local parish church. The main types of housing (few as they were), were farms, scattered widely.
